00012 //
00013 // To use this Class just add  #include "MastEventReceiver.cpp"  to the end of your includes list. (or add the class in-line into your program)
00014 // Then create an instance of it like so: MastEventReceiver eventReceiver;
00015 // Then call the initialization fucntion like so: eventReceiver.init();
00016 // Then inside your Main Game Loop place "eventReceiver.endEventProcess();" in the beginning of your game loop, before anything -
00017 // that would require input, then put "eventReceiver.startEventProcess();" at the very end of your Main Game Loop.
00018 // yeah I know it's confusing, but it makes alot more sense in the internals of the class.
00019 //
00021 
00022 // Change this to the path where your Irrlicht Header Files are.
00023 #include "irrlicht.h"
00024 
00028 class MastEventReceiver : public irr::IEventReceiver
00029 {
00030 
00031    protected:
00032    // Enumeration for UP, DOWN, PRESSED and RELEASED key states. Also used for mouse button states.
00033    enum keyStatesENUM {UP, DOWN, PRESSED, RELEASED};
00034 
00035    // Enumeration for Event Handling State.
00036    enum processStateENUM {STARTED, ENDED};
00037 
00038    // Mouse button states.
00039    keyStatesENUM mouseButtonState[2]; //Left(0), Middle(1) and Right(2) Buttons.
00040 
00041    // Keyboard key states.
00042    keyStatesENUM keyState[irr::KEY_KEY_CODES_COUNT];
00043 
00044    // Mouse X/Y coordinates and Wheel data.
00045    struct mouseData
00046    {
00047    int X;
00048    int Y;
00049    float wheel; //wheel is how far the wheel has moved
00050    };
00051    struct mouseData mouse;
00052 
00053    processStateENUM processState; // STARTED = handling events, ENDED = not handling events
00054 
00055    virtual bool OnEvent(irr::SEvent event)
00056    {
00057       bool eventprocessed = false;
00058 
00060       // Keyboard Input Event
00062           if (event.EventType == irr::EET_KEY_INPUT_EVENT)
00063       {
00064          if (processState == STARTED)
00065          {
00066             // if key is Pressed Down
00067             if (event.KeyInput.PressedDown == true)
00068             {
00069                // If key was not down before
00070                if (keyState[event.KeyInput.Key] != DOWN)
00071                {
00072                   keyState[event.KeyInput.Key] = PRESSED; // Set to Pressed
00073                }
00074                else
00075                {
00076                   // if key was down before
00077                   keyState[event.KeyInput.Key] = DOWN; // Set to Down
00078                }
00079             }
00080             else
00081             {
00082 
00083                   // if the key is down
00084                   if (keyState[event.KeyInput.Key] != UP)
00085                   {
00086                      keyState[event.KeyInput.Key] = RELEASED; // Set to Released
00087                   }
00088             }
00089          }
00090 
00091 
00092          eventprocessed = true;
00093       }
00094 
00096       // Mouse Input Event
00098 
00099           if (event.EventType == irr::EET_MOUSE_INPUT_EVENT)
00100       {
00101          if (processState == STARTED)
00102          {
00103             //Mouse changed position
00104                          if (event.MouseInput.Event == irr::EMIE_MOUSE_MOVED)
00105             {
00106                mouse.Y = event.MouseInput.Y;
00107                mouse.X = event.MouseInput.X;
00108             }
00109 
00110             //Wheel moved.
00111                          if (event.MouseInput.Event == irr::EMIE_MOUSE_WHEEL)
00112             {
00113                mouse.wheel += event.MouseInput.Wheel;
00114             }
00115 
00116             //Left Mouse Button Pressed
00117                          if (event.MouseInput.Event == irr::EMIE_LMOUSE_PRESSED_DOWN)
00118             {
00119                //
00120                if (mouseButtonState[0] == UP || mouseButtonState[0] == RELEASED)
00121                {
00122                   mouseButtonState[0] = PRESSED;
00123                }
00124                else
00125                {
00126                   mouseButtonState[0] = DOWN;
00127                }
00128             }
00129 
00130             //Left Mouse Button Rleased
00131                         if (event.MouseInput.Event == irr::EMIE_LMOUSE_LEFT_UP)
00132             {
00133                //
00134                if (mouseButtonState[0] != UP)
00135                {
00136                   mouseButtonState[0] = RELEASED;
00137                }
00138             }
00139 
00140             //Middle Mouse Button Pressed
00141                         if (event.MouseInput.Event == irr::EMIE_MMOUSE_PRESSED_DOWN)
00142             {
00143                //
00144                if (mouseButtonState[1] == UP || mouseButtonState[1] == RELEASED)
00145                {
00146                   mouseButtonState[1] = PRESSED;
00147                }
00148                else
00149                {
00150                   mouseButtonState[1] = DOWN;
00151                }
00152             }
00153 
00154             //Middle Mouse Button Rleased
00155                         if (event.MouseInput.Event == irr::EMIE_MMOUSE_LEFT_UP)
00156             {
00157                //
00158                if (mouseButtonState[1] != UP)
00159                {
00160                   mouseButtonState[1] = RELEASED;
00161                }
00162             }
00163 
00164             //Right Mouse Button Pressed
00165                         if (event.MouseInput.Event == irr::EMIE_RMOUSE_PRESSED_DOWN)
00166             {
00167                //
00168                if (mouseButtonState[2] == UP || mouseButtonState[2] == RELEASED)
00169                {
00170                   mouseButtonState[2] = PRESSED;
00171                }
00172                else
00173                {
00174                   mouseButtonState[2] = DOWN;
00175                }
00176             }
00177 
00178             //Right Mouse Button Rleased
00179                         if (event.MouseInput.Event == irr::EMIE_RMOUSE_LEFT_UP)
00180             {
00181                //
00182                if (mouseButtonState[2] != UP)
00183                {
00184                   mouseButtonState[2] = RELEASED;
00185                }
00186             }
00187          }
00188 
00189 
00190          eventprocessed = true;
00191       }
00192 
00193 
00194       return eventprocessed;
00195    }

00218    bool leftMouseReleased()
00219    {
00220       if (mouseButtonState[0] == RELEASED)
00221       {
00222          return true;
00223       }
00224       else
00225       {
00226          return false;
00227       }
00228    }
00229    bool leftMouseUp()
00230    {
00231       if (mouseButtonState[0] == RELEASED || mouseButtonState[0] == UP)
00232       {
00233          return true;
00234       }
00235       else
00236       {
00237          return false;

00359    bool keyPressed(char keycode)
00360    {
00361       if (keyState[keycode] == PRESSED)
00362       {
00363          return true;
00364       }
00365       else
00366       {
00367          return false;
00368       }
00369    }
00370 
00371    bool keyDown(char keycode)
00372    {
00373       if (keyState[keycode] == DOWN || keyState[keycode] == PRESSED)
00374       {
00375          return true;
00376       }
00377       else
00378       {
00379          return false;
00380       }
00381    }
00382 
00383    bool keyUp(char keycode)
00384    {
00385       if (keyState[keycode] == UP || keyState[keycode] == RELEASED)
00386       {
00387          return true;
00388       }
00389       else
00390       {
00391          return false;
00392       }
00393    }
00394 
00395    bool keyReleased(char keycode)
00396    {
00397       if (keyState[keycode] == RELEASED)
00398       {
00399          return true;
00400       }
00401       else
00402       {
00403          return false;
00404       }
00405    }

00408    // This is used so that the Key States will not be changed during execution of your Main game loop.
00409    // Place this at the very START of your Main Loop
00410    void endEventProcess()
00411    {
00412       processState = ENDED;
00413    }
00414 
00415    // This is used so that the Key States will not be changed during execution of your Main game loop.
00416    // Place this function at the END of your Main Loop.
00417    void startEventProcess()
00418    {
00419 
00420       processState = STARTED;
00421       //Keyboard Key States
00422       for (int i = 0; i < irr::KEY_KEY_CODES_COUNT; i++)
00423       {
00424          if (keyState[i] == RELEASED)
00425          {
00426             keyState[i] = UP;
00427          }
00428 
00429          if (keyState[i] == PRESSED)
00430          {
00431             keyState[i] = DOWN;
00432          }
00433       }
00434       //Mouse Button States
00435       for (int i = 0; i <= 2; i++)
00436       {
00437          if (mouseButtonState[i] == RELEASED)
00438          {
00439             mouseButtonState[i] = UP;
00440          }
00441 
00442          if (mouseButtonState[i] == PRESSED)
00443          {
00444             mouseButtonState[i] = DOWN;
00445          }
00446       }
00447       //Mouse Wheel state
00448       mouse.wheel = 0.0f;
00449 
00450    }
00451 
00452    void init()
00453    {
00454       //KeyBoard States.
00455       for (int i = 0; i <= irr::KEY_KEY_CODES_COUNT; i++)
00456       {
00457          keyState[i] = UP;
00458       }
00459       //Mouse states
00460       for (int i = 0; i <= 2; i++)
00461       {
00462          mouseButtonState[i] = UP;
00463       }
00464       //Mouse X/Y coordenates.
00465       mouse.X = 0;
00466       mouse.Y = 0;
00467       mouse.wheel = 0.0f;
00468    }
